questions.question: It is not a crime if someone who is 17 has sex with someone who is 15.
questions.resources: If someone is more than 2 years (24 months) older than you, you cannot agree (give consent) to sex, sexual touching or sexual acts being performed in front of you.

questions.question: People over the age of 18 can consent to having sex with anyone over 18.
questions.resources: It is not a crime, if both people are over 18, and have both agreed (given consent).

questions.question: If you don't agree to sex & someone threatens or touches you sexually they are breaking the law
questions.resources: Also, if someone has sex with you, or touches you while you are asleep, unconscious or affected by alcohol/drugs and you cannot consent, it is still sexual assault.

questions.question: If you start to have sex with someone, but change your mind, they have the right to continue
questions.resources: That is sexual assault, no one has the right to touch you or continue with a sexual act if you change your mind. Even if you have given consent once before, you must give consent every time.

questions.question: It is child pornography if you take a nude/semi-nude pic of a person under 18
questions.resources: According to the law, it IS child pornography, and there are serious legal consequences for this.

questions.question: If you are under 18, you are allowed to visit the doctor to discuss and get contraception
questions.resources: True. Make sure you know your doctors policy about privacy. They are usually mandated to keep the conversations private (cannot tell your parents/family).

questions.question: There are age limits on who can/cannot purchase condoms
questions.resources: False. There are no age limits and can be purchased at most chemists, supermarkets and petrol stations.

choices.answer: Someone touching, pinching, or brushing up against someone
Kissing or hugging another person when they didn't say yes

questions.question: The word to explain taking nude, semi nude or sexual photos and sending it to others is called
Are 16 and 17 year old's allowed to get married?

choices.answer: Yes, if your parents agree & the other person is at least 18

questions.question: A person aged 16 or 17 can have sex with a person who is in a position of care or authority
questions.resources: Incorrect. This is illegal. The person in a position of authority cannot coerce them, it is their job to protect them.

questions.question: It is legal to have sex with a family member, including step brothers, step sisters & cousins.
There are different age restrictions for sex in Victoria with hetero &homosexual relationships.
questions.resources: False!! The same rules apply regardless of a person's sexual orientation.

choices.answer: Only when one person is under 16.
When one or more people are under 18.
When it involves harassing people of any age.
When both people are adults and consent to it.

questions.question: Stacy (16) reported her boyfriend Tom (18) for demanding naked images. Will he get in trouble?

choices.answer: No, as he is over eighteen.
No, because up until now the relationship was loving/safe.
No, because Stacey went to a school councilor, not police.

questions.question: Does consent need to be granted each time you have sex?

choices.answer: Not if you are a married couple
